Keep these words.

Source: R/keepWords.R
keepWords.Rd

Extract words based on their position in a character string, vectorised over string.

keepWords(string, slc = 1, punct.rm = TRUE, na.rm = FALSE,
  collapse = NULL)

Arguments

string

Input vector. A character vector or list from which words will be extracted.
slc

Vector of integer indicating the selected positions of the words to be kept.
punct.rm

A logical indicating whether punctuation characters should be removed.
na.rm

A logical indicating whether missing values should be removed.
collapse

An optional character string used to separate selected words. Not NA_character_.

Value

A vector of the selected words concatenated for each string.

Examples

strex <- 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.'
keepWords(strex)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "Lorem"
#> 
keepWords(c(strex,'A second chacter string.'), slc=c(1,8), na.rm=TRUE)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "Lorem" "elit" 
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A"
#> 
keepWords(c(strex,'A second chacter string.'), slc=c(1,8), na.rm=TRUE, collapse='/')
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "Lorem/elit"
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A"
#>
